title: AGI Timeline Assessment: Still 10 Years Away
description: Andrej Karpathy maintains that AGI is still a decade away, critiquing overly optimistic predictions. He emphasizes that AI represents 'summoning ghosts, not building animals' - a different form of intelligence that requires continued fundamental research.
author: Andrej Karpathy

title: NanoChat: Build ChatGPT for $100
description: Karpathy released an open-source project showing how to build a ChatGPT-like LLM from scratch for ~$100, demonstrating practical approaches to cost-effective LLM implementation and making AI systems more accessible.
author: Andrej Karpathy

title: AI for Data Engineers - Podcast Discussion
description: Simon Willison discusses AI tools and applications specifically for data engineers, covering practical implementations of LLMs in data engineering workflows and emerging best practices.
author: Simon Willison

title: Things We Learned About LLMs in 2024
description: Comprehensive year-end review covering major developments in Large Language Models throughout 2024, including technical improvements, adoption patterns, and lessons learned for practical implementation.
author: Simon Willison

title: Replit Agent 3: Autonomous AI Coding
description: Amjad Masad announced Replit Agent 3, an AI coder that can build applications, test them, and automate workflows autonomously for extended periods. The product reportedly quintupled Replit's revenue.
author: Amjad Masad

title: Building for 1 Billion Developers
description: Masad discusses Replit's vision of democratizing software development to reach a billion developers worldwide through AI-powered tools that lower the barrier to entry for programming.
author: Amjad Masad

title: Chris Lattner: Future of Programming and AI
description: Lex Fridman interviews Chris Lattner about the integration of AI into programming languages, compilers, and development tools, discussing the future of software engineering in the AI era.
author: Lex Fridman & Chris Lattner

title: DHH: Future of Programming with AI
description: David Heinemeier Hansson discusses AI's impact on programming from the perspective of Ruby on Rails creator, offering thoughtful critiques and practical perspectives on AI's role in software development.
author: Lex Fridman & DHH

title: Superpowers: Using Coding Agents in October 2025
description: Hacker News discussion revealing that AI coding agents work best for beginners and lead engineers, with mixed results for mid-level developers. Community shares practical experiences and limitations.
author: Hacker News Community

title: Top AI Vibe Coding Tools of 2025
description: Community discussion about the best AI coding tools, with Cursor being mentioned as 'quite good' and discussion of MCP tools integration with Jira and GitHub. Clear distinction between 'vibe coding' and AI-assisted engineering.
author: Hacker News Community

title: Enhancing LLM Code Generation Through Test-Driven Development
description: November 2025 arXiv paper presenting methods to improve LLM code generation quality by integrating test-driven development approaches and code interpreter capabilities.
author: Academic Researchers

title: A Survey on Code Generation with LLM-based Agents
description: Comprehensive July 2025 survey paper analyzing how LLM-powered agents are revolutionizing software development, covering current capabilities, limitations, and future research directions.
author: Academic Researchers

title: Best Coding LLM as of November 2025
description: Reddit r/LocalLLaMA discussion from November 2025 about the best coding LLMs, with users specifically looking for Java coding capabilities and at least 100K context window support for complex projects.
author: Reddit Community

title: AI Tools Make Experienced Developers 19% Slower
description: Reddit discussion referencing studies that found AI tools can make experienced programmers slower, sparking debate about the practical effectiveness and learning curve of AI coding assistance.
author: Reddit Community
